newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SPC does not expect better second half.
newsitem.headline: SPC does not expect better second half.

text.p: Singapore Petroleum Co Ltd said on Friday it does not expect its second half performance to be better than the first half.
The company said this was becuase refining margins are expected to weaken in the second half due to more intense competition from new plants coming onstream in Thailand and South Korea.
For its half year ending June 30, the refiner reported a net profit to Singapore $20.83 million against a loss of S$3.92 million from the previous corresponding period.
It said the improved margins of the last quarter of 1995 continued in the first half of 1996, enabling the group to record a profit.
